fields.label: SEO Title Separator
fields.name: seoTitleSeparator
fields.hint: Separator for titles. For instance, use " | " or " - ", without quotes. This will be used to separate the page name from the site name. Be sure to include spaces before and after the separator if desired.

fields.label: Site-Wide Post SEO Settings
fields.name: siteWidePostSeoSettings
fields.hint: ↑ Post SEO (Search Engine Optimization) templates can be used to quickly change SEO and sharing settings for all posts that don't override them.

fields.label: SEO Title
fields.name: seoTitle
fields.hint: The title shown in the browser tab and in Google search results. Use an attention-grabbing title and keep this to 50-60 characters or shorter for best results. You can use the tags {siteName}, {siteDescription}, {contentTitle}, and {contentSeoDescription}.

fields.label: SEO Description
fields.name: seoDescription
fields.hint: A description of the content. Can also be an excerpt, if you want. At least two sentences long is recommended, and it should entice users to click. You can use the tags {siteName}, {siteDescription}, {contentTitle}, and {contentSeoDescription}.

fields.label: SEO Image
fields.name: seoImage
fields.hint: ↑ Select the image used when sharing. Unless customized below, this will be used as the Open Graph and Twitter Card image when sharing the page.

fields.label: Use Site Image
fields.name: useSiteImage
fields.hint: When switched on, the site image (specified in Site Settings) will be used and the Custom Image below will be ignored.

fields.label: Custom SEO Image
fields.name: customSeoImage
fields.hint: To use a custom SEO image, you must disable Use Site Image above. Select an image that's bigger than 1200×630 and looks good when cropped into a square. Facebook recommends a 1200×630 (1.91:1) and will crop the top and bottom of larger images. Reddit will crop and resize images to 70×70. Twitter Cards can use either square or wide images depending on the card type being used, but the default is a square. Use a different URL for new images or the image won't be updated by Facebook.

fields.label: Custom SEO Image Alt
fields.name: customSeoImageAlt
fields.hint: A description of what's happening in the custom image. This is used for accessibility, so visually impaired readers can know what's up.

fields.label: Open Graph

fields.label: OG Title

fields.label: OG Description

fields.label: Open Graph Image
fields.name: ogImage
fields.hint: Open Graph image settings.

fields.label: Use Custom OG Image
fields.name: ogUseCustomOgImage
fields.hint: Enable to use the custom image for Open Graph specified below. Otherwise, the SEO Image configured above will be used.

fields.label: Custom OG Image

fields.label: Custom OG Image Alt

fields.label: Twitter Cards
fields.name: twitterCards
fields.hint: ↑ Settings for the Twitter Cards that are created when sharing your page on Twitter.

fields.label: Twitter Card Type
fields.name: twitterCardType
fields.hint: Choose the card type. Regular summary cards use a square image and place the image next to the content, while the summary card with large image places the image above the card's text.

fields.label: Twitter Card Title
fields.name: twitterCardTitle
fields.hint: The title shown when someone shares your page on Twitter. You can use the tags {siteName}, {siteDescription}, {contentTitle}, and {contentSeoDescription}.

fields.label: Twitter Card Description
fields.name: twitterCardDescription
fields.hint: The description shown when someone shares your page on Twitter. You can use the tags {siteName}, {siteDescription}, {contentTitle}, and {contentSeoDescription}.

fields.label: Twitter Card Image
fields.name: twitterCardImage
fields.hint: Twitter Card image settings.

fields.label: Use Custom Twitter Card Image
fields.name: twitterCardUseCustomImage
fields.hint: Enable to override the SEO Image (above) for Twitter Cards, specifying a different one below.

fields.label: Custom Twitter Card Image
fields.name: twitterCardCustomImage
fields.hint: The custom image for Twitter Cards. You must switch on Use Custom Twitter Card Image above for this to take effect. You should not use a generic image such as your website logo, author photo, or other image that spans multiple pages. Images for Summary Card support an aspect ratio of 1:1 with minimum dimensions of 144x144 or maximum of 4096x4096 pixels, and will be cropped to a square on all platforms. Images for Summary Card With Large Image support an aspect ratio of 2:1 with minimum dimensions of 300x157 or maximum of 4096x4096 pixels. Images must be less than 5MB in size. JPG, PNG, WEBP and GIF formats are supported. Only the first frame of an animated GIF will be used. SVG is not supported.

fields.label: Custom Twitter Card Image Alt
fields.name: twitterCardCustomImageAlt
fields.hint: A description of what's happening in the custom Twitter Card image. This is for accessibility, so visually impaired readers can know what's up.

fields.label: Twitter Card Site Username
fields.name: twitterCardSiteUsername
fields.hint: The site username that the Twitter Card is attributed to, prefixed with the @ symbol. Use {twitterSiteUsername} to specify the site username set in Social & Sharing Settings.
